body: ## Steps to Reproduce _Please tell us what you were doing and what went wrong_ I don't have code completion but strictly with a Flutter Plugin project only. On a fresh project via the Android Studio wizard everything is marked as a non-project file (highlighted yellow). After a `flutter clean` all of my files are included properly, but of course imports and such don't work anymore. Doing a `flutter pub get` also does not show the Dart Packages in the External Libraries, but if I delete just the bottom most line in the `.packages` file that references my project, everything seems to work completely fine again. I have to do this every time after each `flutter pub get` though. Before: After deleting `encrypted_file_flutter:lib/`: I know the [dot packages file is deprecated](https://dart.dev/go/dot-packages-deprecation), but it seems to still be in use here. Are there plans to remedy this? I brought this up in #4610 as well but did not get a response for over a month. ## Version info ```sh $ flutter doctor --verbose [âœ“] Flutter (Channel stable, 2.5.1, on macOS 11.1 20C69 darwin-x64, locale en-US) â€¢ Flutter version 2.5.1 at /usr/local/Caskroom/flutter/2.2.3/flutter â€¢ Upstream repository https://github.com/flutter/flutter.git â€¢ Framework revision ffb2ecea52 (2 weeks ago), 2021-09-17 15:26:33 -0400 â€¢ Engine revision b3af521a05 â€¢ Dart version 2.14.2 [âœ“] Android toolchain - develop for Android devices (Android SDK version 30.0.3) â€¢ Android SDK at ~/Library/Android/sdk â€¢ Platform android-30, build-tools 30.0.3 â€¢ ANDROID_HOME = ~/Library/Android/sdk â€¢ ANDROID_SDK_ROOT = ~/Library/Android/sdk â€¢ Java binary at: /Applications/Android Studio 2.app/Contents/jre/Contents/Home/bin/java â€¢ Java version OpenJDK Runtime Environment (build 11.0.10+0-b96-7281165) â€¢ All Android licenses accepted. [âœ“] Xcode - develop for iOS and macOS â€¢ Xcode at /Applications/Xcode_12.5.1.app/Contents/Developer â€¢ Xcode 12.5.1, Build version 12E507 â€¢ CocoaPods version 1.10.2 [âœ“] Chrome - develop for the web â€¢ Chrome at /Applications/Google Chrome.app/Contents/MacOS/Google Chrome [âœ“] Android Studio (version 4.2) â€¢ Android Studio at /Applications/Android Studio.app/Contents â€¢ Flutter plugin can be installed from: ðŸ”¨ https://plugins.jetbrains.com/plugin/9212-flutter â€¢ Dart plugin can be installed from: ðŸ”¨ https://plugins.jetbrains.com/plugin/6351-dart â€¢ Java version OpenJDK Runtime Environment (build 11.0.8+10-b944.6916264) [âœ“] Android Studio (version 2020.3) â€¢ Android Studio at /Applications/Android Studio 2.app/Contents â€¢ Flutter plugin can be installed from: ðŸ”¨ https://plugins.jetbrains.com/plugin/9212-flutter â€¢ Dart plugin can be installed from: ðŸ”¨ https://plugins.jetbrains.com/plugin/6351-dart â€¢ Java version OpenJDK Runtime Environment (build 11.0.10+0-b96-7281165) [âœ“] IntelliJ IDEA Ultimate Edition (version 2021.1.3) â€¢ IntelliJ at /Applications/IntelliJ IDEA.app â€¢ Flutter plugin can be installed from: ðŸ”¨ https://plugins.jetbrains.com/plugin/9212-flutter â€¢ Dart plugin version 211.7792 [âœ“] VS Code (version 1.60.2) â€¢ VS Code at /Applications/Visual Studio Code.app/Contents â€¢ Flutter extension can be installed from: ðŸ”¨ https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=Dart-Code.flutter [âœ“] Proxy Configuration â€¢ HTTP_PROXY is set â€¢ NO_PROXY is localhost,10.0.2.2,127.0.0.1 â€¢ NO_PROXY contains 127.0.0.1 â€¢ NO_PROXY contains localhost [âœ“] Connected device (2 available) â€¢ Nathanâ€™s iPhone (mobile) â€¢ d2c75943df065039bfe4b5dfe5271b2a5b20c778 â€¢ ios â€¢ iOS 14.6 18F72 â€¢ Chrome (web) â€¢ chrome â€¢ web-javascript â€¢ Google Chrome 94.0.4606.61 â€¢ No issues found! ```

comment_data.body: This is working as intended for plugin projects. The yellow background means the files are part of a project library, which is necessary to get all the IDE support for a plugin.

title: No Intellisense in Flutter Plugin projects
